root.name: Victory
root.description: OverviewVictory is a racing themed pinball machine developed and manufactured by Gottlieb in 1987. Victory is the first of only three machines to use a photo realistic Vitrigraph mylar. This Vitrigraph Mylar is an overlay that was used on the play field. Most pinball machines at the time used a silk screen on the play field instead. The process of using a Vitrigraph instead of silk screen was only used by Gottlieb and only on Victory, Diamond Lady, and TX-Sector.
